intro: Melampodium mimulifolium, commonly known as the golden cup, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and roadsides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Melampodium mimulifolium is often used in ornamental gardening for its vibrant color and drought tolerance.
